message: Hello Bob, I have a unique product that I think you'll be interested in. I'm open to negotiations, but I need to make a starting point. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $18,000.
I'm really interested in the product, but $18,000 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $12,000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand that $18,000 is a bit steep for you, Bob. However, I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $15,000. This is my best offer, and I'm not sure if I can go any lower.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but $15,000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $10,000 for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand that $15,000 is still too high for you, Bob. However, I really need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you at $13,500. This is a compromise, and I'm not sure if I can go any lower.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but $13,500 is still a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $11,000 for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. I'm willing to make one more serious compromise. I can meet you at $14,000. This is my final offer, and I'm not sure if I can go any lower.

I appreciate your willingness to make one more compromise, Alice, but $14,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $10,500 for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I've compromised as much as I can, Bob. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $13,000. This is my last offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
I appreciate your willingness to sell the product to me, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $11,500. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any higher.
